The X-Trail is a four-wheel drive 4 door with 5 seats, powered by a 2.5L INLINE 4 engine that has 126 kW of power (at 6000 rpm) and 226 Nm of torque (at 4400 rpm) via a Continuous Variable. NISSAN claims the X-Trail Ti (4WD) uses 8.3L/100km of Unleaded Petrol in the combined city and highway cycle while putting out 192g of CO2. It has a 60L fuel tank, meaning it should be able to travel 723km per full tank.

One of the country’s best-selling SUVs, the CR-V gets some minor changes for 2020. Aside from some styling enhancements and new alloy wheel designs, the SUV now includes the Honda Sensing safety suite as standard equipment, which includes adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist and emergency autonomous braking, among other functionalities. The turbocharged, 1.5-litre four-cylinder engine produces 190 horsepower, and is one of the most fuel-efficient in its class.

The Yaris Cross measures 1590mm (62.6 inches) in height, 4180mm (164.6 inches) in length, 1765mm (69.5 inches) in width with a 2560mm (100.8 inches) wheelbase that brings about a total of 1140kg (2513.3 lbs) of unladen weight. The Yaris Cross GX comes standard with 205/65 R16 front tyres and 205/65 R16 rear tyres.
